sub_topic: Identifying the perfect matching in a graph.
message_1:
Consider a graph G with 6 vertices and 7 edges as shown below:

```
      1
     / \
    2   3
   / \ / \
  4 - 5 - 6
```

Determine whether G has a perfect matching or not. If it has, identify the vertices that are part of the matching.
message_2:
A perfect matching is a set of edges such that every vertex in the graph is incident to exactly one edge in the set, and no two edges in the set share a common vertex.

In graph G, we can find a perfect matching:

1. Connect vertex 1 to vertex 2.
2. Connect vertex 3 to vertex 5.
3. Connect vertex 4 to vertex 6.

The perfect matching consists of the edges (1, 2), (3, 5), and (4, 6). Each vertex is connected to exactly one other vertex in the matching, and no two edges share a common vertex.
